title: Create a request in Live Support
content:
The following applies when you are in Live Support. To go to the Live Support page, select Run > Service Request > Live Support.

If you are already dealing with a Live Support call:

To deal with the next caller:

Click Save & next. This action:

  • Saves the current request form as a request record.
  • Displays a new, blank request form.
  • Clears the current caller's details from the screen.

You can now select the next caller.

To deal with the next request from the current caller:

Click the Save & next drop-down then Save & next request. This action:

  • Saves the current request form as a request record.
  • Displays a new, blank request form, ready for the next request from the same caller.
  • Keeps the current caller's details displayed.

To create a service request:

  1. Type the details in the Description or Title field.

    Service Management filters available solutions items according to the text you type, and displays the number of relevant search results in each part of the Suggestions Bar.

    If you add more text to either field, the search results automatically update.

  2. Click one of the icons on the Suggestions Bar to display solutions in the Solutions Pane.

    For more information about the Suggestions Bar, see Suggestions Bar, List Pane, and Preview Pane.

  3. You can also choose a solution by clicking the Offering field.

  4. If nothing suitable appears, you can use the search box to search for relevant material.

  5. Then do one of the following to create the request:

    Available material Action
    • Offerings

    1. Select the offering.

    2. In the Preview Pane, click .

    3. Complete the information in the New request form. For field descriptions, see the Live Support request form details page.

    4. Click the Related CIs icon on the Suggestions Bar, to relate a CI to the request. For more information, see the How to relate a CI to a new request section.

    5. Click Save.

    • Article

    • News item

    • Question

    1. Select the article or question.

    2. In the Preview Pane, click .

    3. Complete the information in the New request form. For field descriptions, see the Live Support request form details page.

    4. Click the Related CIs icon on the Suggestions Bar, to relate a CI to the request. For more information, the How to relate a CI to a new request section.

    5. Click Save.
    • Incident

    1. Select the incident.

    2. In the Preview Pane, click .

    3. Complete the information in the New request form. For field descriptions, see the Live Support request form details page.

    4. Click the Related CIs icon on the Suggestions Bar, to relate a CI to the request. For more information, the How to relate a CI to a new request section.

    5. Click Save.

    • None

      (No suitable offering, article, news item, question, or incident)

    1. Complete the information in the New request form. For field descriptions, see the Live Support request form details page.

    2. Click the Related CIs icon on the Suggestions Bar, to relate a CI to the request. For more information, the How to relate a CI to a new request section.

    3. Click Save.

Requests created in Live Support display there using a different format, with less of the record details appearing. However, you can view the complete details by clicking Full details, or by going to Run > Service Request > Requests.

How to relate a CI to a new request

You can relate a CI to a new request, when you are working on it, and before you save the request.

To relate a CI:

  1. Click the Related CIs icon on the Suggestions Bar.
  2. Click either User CIs or Location CIs, as appropriate.
  3. Select a record to display details in the Preview Pane.
  4. Click .
